column4: Please help me with this error when I open synaptic http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d7c1b2fdd
which distribution are you using?
did you launch synaptic like "sudo synaptic"
i opened it from the menu.
ok
try commenting out any entry in /etc/apt/sources.list (and sources.list.d files if any) and do "sudo apt-get update"
after that you can try to re-launch synaptic
I see the linuxmint line and you say you are running ubuntu 9.04
no i was just saying that I get the same error on my laptop that is runnning jaunty and not mint
so you are running mint?
so comment ANY line?
yes, try putting a # on each line
so you mean every line or just 1 line
if you open the file with VIM, you can do this ":1,$ s/^/#/"
every line
ok i just wanted that clarified. I suck wit VIM i have it open in gedit now.
are you winning?
got this error now http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d3b01c673
I've never encountered this type of a problem. have you checked this page: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=332671 ?
someone just helped me fix it. I removed all the files in /var/lib/apt/lists/ and ran update and it worked.
wow, I suspected that but was hesitating it would work
i didn't actually delete the files. I just moved them to a different directory just in case. thank you for your help though.
thanks for feedback on how you solved it
